creditline: Gift of funds from Regis Foundation
description: four panels stitched together; indigo sky/ground with white clouds and grasses; red and brown resist dyed cranes, with seven flying birds and other birds on ground; mounted on board
text: Indigo dyed cotton door curtains (noren) were typically hung across the entrances or gateways to homes in traditional Japan. Unlike professionally produced noren for shops and businesses, noren for private homes were typically designed and decorated by the home's mistress. This beautiful example shows a flock of red-crested cranes--long symbols of longevity in Asia--flying amid clouds and standing in a field of autumn grasses.
title: (Doorway Curtain)
